_dc:description: A persistent identifier for a germplasm accession maintained as part of an ex situ genebank collection. Best practice is to use a globally unique and persistent identifier (PID).
_examples: URI, DOI, LSID or similar; http://data.gbif.org/occurrences/215969415/

_dc:description: Accession name. Either a registered or other formal designation given to the accession.
_examples: Rheinische Vorgebirgstrauben; Emma; Avlon

_dc:description: The biological status for a germplasm accession describes the cultivation status and distinguish wild and primitive cultivars from modern cultivars and breeding lines (material under development).
_examples: Wild; Crop wild relative (CWR); Primitive; Traditional cultivar; Landrace; Breeding line; Genetic stock; Modern cultivar; 100; 110; 120; 200; 300; 400; 410; 411; 412; 413; 414; 415; 420; 500; 999

_dc:description: Type of germplasm storage conditions.
_examples: 10; 11; 12; 13; 20; 30; 40; 99, refer to FAO/IPGRI Genebank Standards 1994 for details on storage type.

_dc:description: Collecting institute ID.
_examples: SWE054; urn:lsid:biocol.org:col:35293, an established institute code for the collecting/gathering institute.

_dc:description: Latitude of the collecting site for the source germplasm material.
Longitude of the collecting site for the source germplasm material.
Altitude of the collecting site for the source germplasm material.
An identifier for the set of location information (data associated with dcterms:Location). May be a globally unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.
_examples: http://sws.geonames.org/2726528/

_dc:description: Persistent identifier for the source germplasm developed by a plant breeder.
_examples: Persistent identifier (PID) such as a URI, DOI, LSID or similar.

_dc:description: The germplasm name or accession number used by the plant breeder.
_examples: Could be the breeders catalog number, or the name under which a cultivar was marketed.

_dc:description: The year a germplasm accession was developed by a plant breeder. Could be the year the cultivar was released.
Name of the country in which the breeding event took place.
_examples: Denmark; Finland; Iceland; Norway; Sweden

_dc:description: Code for the country in which the breeding event took place.
_examples: DNK; FIN; ISL; NOR; SWE

_dc:description: Breeding institute code.
_examples: SWE006; urn:lsid:biocol.org:col:35293

_dc:description: Breeder institute name. If the FAO WIEWS institute code is available, this term is not to be reported.
_examples: Sval√∂f Weibull AB Cereal Breeding Department

_dc:description: Name of the plant breeder.
_examples: Gregor Mendel; Luther Burbank; Nils Herman Nilsson-Ehle

_dc:description: Ancestral data, ANCEST. Information about either pedigree or other description of ancestral information.
_examples: A pedigree, Hanna/7*Atlas//Turk/8*Atlas; or a description, mutation found in Hanna; selection from Irene.

_dc:description: Ancestral information following the purdy pedigree format.
_examples: Hanna/7*Atlas//Turk/8*Atlas

_dc:description: Remarks to the breeding event.
_examples: Supplementary comments and remarks related to the breeding event

_dc:description: An identifier for the event when germplasm material was acquired and included in the genebank collection.
_examples: URI, DOI, LSID or similar

_dc:description: An identifier for the source germplasm material that was included in your genebank collection.
_examples: http://data.gbif.org/occurrences/164390781/; URI, DOI, LSID or similar

_dc:description: An identifier for the source accession donated to your genebank collection. Could be an unique and stable local identifier specific to the dataset.
_examples: NGB1

_dc:description: Donor institute code.
_examples: DEU146; NLD037; SWE054; urn:lsid:biocol.org:col:35293

_dc:description: Donor institute name. If the FAO WIEWS institute code is available, this term is not to be reported.
_examples: Nordic Genetic Resources Center (NordGen)

_dc:description: Acquisition date, date when the germplasm material (accession) entered the genebank collection.
Collecting/acquisition source.
Remarks to the acquisition event.
_examples: General remarks related to the acquisition of the germplasm accession.

_dc:description: A persistent identifier for the genebank accession in the safe duplication storage.
_examples: URI, DOI, LSID or similar (for the accession in the safety duplication storage)

_dc:description: Date of safety duplication.
Location of safety duplicates. Persistent identifier for the institute where a safety duplicate of the accession is maintained.
_examples: NOR051; urn:lsid:biocol.org:col:35294

_dc:description: Location or institute for storage of safety duplicates.
_examples: The name of the safety duplication institute

_dc:description: Remarks to the safety duplication event.
_examples: General remarks related to the safety duplication of the germplasm material.

_dc:description: An identifier for the germplasm regulation or treaty.
_examples: URI, DOI, LSID or similar

_dc:description: Regulation or treaty name.
_examples: The International Treaty for Plant Genetic Resources for Food and Agriculture (ITPGRFA)

_dc:description: Governing body for the regulation or treaty.
_examples: Use the WIEWS institute code when possible

_dc:description: The status of a germplasm accession with regards to the Multilateral System (MLS) of the International TReaty on Plant Genetic Resources for Food and Agriculture.
_examples: No; Yes; Other
